volumes.title: Baptisms, Burials and Marriages - 16th & 17th Centuries
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Burials
Marriages
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 1 - Baptisms, Burials and Marriages contains records created in Florida during the late-sixteenth and seventeenth centuries.   All records in Box 1 contain information on indios, negros, and españoles. It has the earliest baptismal, marriage, and burial records of the collection.  All of these records seem to have originally comprised a bound volume due to the presence of a title page that reads "Libro de baptismos y matrimonios y entierros hechos en la ciudad de San Agustin de la Florida."  The baptismal records range from 15 June 1594 to 8 January 1616 and comprise folios 4r-41v.  At a minimum, all baptismal entries provide date of baptism; first name of the individual receiving baptism; if known, names of parents; godparent/s (padrino/s) name/s; name and title of priest who performed the baptism; and if not white, then the racial designation or skin color of the individual and/or parents.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following:  legitimacy of birth, current residence of the padrinos, military rank and/or administrative title of any male named in the entry.  The burial records range from 162[1] to 1631 and comprise folios 81r-83v.  At a minimum, these burial entries provide date of burial; if not an infant, name of individual; if not white, racial designation, skin color, or slave status of individual.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to: miliatary rank and/or administrative title of any male named in the entry; name of spouse; whether or not individual has a will; whether or not the individual is a slave.  The marriage records  have two separate date and folio ranges.  The first set of marriage records ranges from 2 February 1594 through 14 June 1616 and comprises folios 84r-96v.  The second set of marriage records ranges from 23 November 1643 to 27 December 1676 and comprise folios 3r-6_v.  At a minimum, all of these marriage entries provide the date of the marriage; names of the bride and groom; name and title of priest who performed the marriage; and if not white, then the racial designation or skin color of the bridge, groom, parents, and/or padrino/s.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: marriage histories of bridge and groom, that is, either single or window/widower (soltero/a, viudo/a); location of marriage; padrinos' names and places of current residence; and military rank and/or administrative title of any male named in the entry.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms, Burials, Confirmations and Marriages - 16th & 17th Centuries
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Burials
Marriages
Confirmations
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 2 - Baptisms, Burials, Confirmations and Marriages contains records created in Florida during the early-seventeenth century.  All records in Box 2 contain information on indios, negros, and españoles.  There is a single confirmation folio dated as 1509 and contains entries from Pueblo de San Francisco and an unknown pueblo.  Almost certainly, these pueblos were not in Florida. The baptismal records range from 10 January 1617 to 9 June 1633.  They comprise two separate folio pagination ranges (42r-80r and 126r-[130]v), but without any noticeable missing entries and with each year accounted for.  At a minimum, each baptismal entry provides name of individual; date of baptism; if known, parents' names; if anyone is a slave, owner's name; name/s of godparent/s (padrino/s); legitimacy of birth; and name and title of priest who performed the baptism.  The burial records range from 6 January 1632 to 15 October 1638 and comprise nine folios, beginning with folio 150r.  At a minimum, each burial entry provides the date of burial; the name and title of presiding priest; place of burial (e.g., convent of San Francisco, hospital, church); individual's name or if individual was too young to have recieved a name, then a parent's name;  and if individual is a slave.    Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: spouse's name; occupation (e.g., marinero); if slave, owner's name.  The confirmations are from 1606 and comprise folios 108r-117v.  The confirmation records provide the individual's name; race, color and/or slave status; and padrino's name.  The marriage records range from 17 June 1616 to 28 November 1631 and comprise folios 97r-107v.  There is an extra marriage folio that contains entries from 19 January 1619 to 3 March 1620, and it is numbered as folio 100.  At a minimum, each marriage entry includes the date of the marriage; names of the bride and groom; name and title of priest who performed the marriage; and if not white, then the racial designation, skin color, or slave status of the bridge, groom, and/or godparent/s (padrino/s).  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: time of day the marriage occured, place the marriage took place (e.g., hospital), military rank and/or administrative title of any male named in the entry.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Marriages - 1632-1720
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Marriages
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 4 - Marriages contains records created in Florida during the seventeenth and early-eighteenth centuries.    All records in Box 4 contain information on Indians, Blacks, Spaniards, and Creoles.  These marriage records range from 18 January 1632 to 23 May 1720 and have several sets of pagination.  At a minimum, each entry records the names of the bride and groom; the date of the marriage; the name and title of the priest; and if the bride and/or groom is not white, then his and/or her skin color or racial designation (negro/a, moreno/a, pardo/a, indio/a [sometimes only referred to as a natural], chino/a [meaning mestizo/a]); if an individual is a slave.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: parents' names, nationalities, places of previous residence, and/or current residence; time of day the marriage was performed; military rank and/or administrative title of any male named in the entry; name and title of priest who performed the diligencias (marriage investigations), read the tres amonestaciones (banns of marriage), and performed the wedding; names of padrinos/testigos (witnesses); the calendar days on which the tres amonestacioneswere read; if an Indian, then from which province or chiefdom (e.g., Guale); whether there were impediments to the marriage; legitimacy of individual's birth; if parents are deceased; if slave, owner's name; and where the ceremony was performed.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms and Burials - 17th Century
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Burials
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 3 - Baptisms and Burials contains records created in Florida during the seventeenth century.  The burial records and the first set of baptismal records contain information on any nationality and racial or ethnic designations; whereas the second set of baptismal records presumably pertains only to españoles or other individuals of European ancestry. The first set of baptismal records in the form of loose folios that ranges from July 1633 to October 1644, with almost all pagination missing.   A second set of baptismal records were originally bound in a volume entitled "Libro segundo de Bautismos Españoles," but are now only loose folios.  This second set of baptismal records ranges from November 1657 to January 1694 and comprises folios 65r-264v.  Folios 170-179 are missing in pagination only.  Folio 211 is misnumbered as 212; thus the folio number 212 appears twice.  At a minimum, each baptismal entry provides name of individual; date of baptism; if known, parents' names; if anyone is a slave, owner's name; name/s of godparent/s (padrino/s); legitimacy of birth; and name and title of priest.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: location of baptism.  The burial records range from August 1632 through July 1634.  At a minimum, each burial entry provides the name and title of presiding priest;  individual's name or if individual was too young to have recieved a name, then a parent's name; whether the individual is Indian (indio/a, natural); and whether a slave, and if so, the owner's name.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: place of burial, military rank and/or administrative title of any male named in the entry, and skin color designation (negro/a, moreno/a, pardo/a).  This box also contains a small scrap of cardstock belonging to a previous filing system.
format: Loose folios and 1 previously-bound volume now in the form of loose folios

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Miscellaneous - 17th, 18th, and 19th Centuries
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Marriages
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 47 - Miscellaneous has four file folders that contain documents created between 1565 and 1821.  The first folder is entitled, "6. Miscellaneous: 1614, 1788, 1835,"  which contains: a 1614 brèves (French, 2 folios), and a 1788 wedding announcement (Spanish, 1 folio).  The second folder is entitled, "Alphabetical Indices - Baptisms (1st Book) St. Augustine," which contains: an index for Box 16 - Baptisms - 1784-1792 (Spanish, 4 folios), and an index for Box 17 - Baptisms - 1784-1792 (Spanish, 4 folios).  The third folder is entitled, "2. Notarized Papers - Marriages, 1778-1785," which includes various documents (Spanish, 16 folios).  The fourth folder is entitled, "Sacramental Register - Baptisms: 1791-1804," which includes an abridged baptismal register, arranged chronologically beginning in 4 February 1791 through 26 April 1804.  These entries presumably appear in their full length in Boxes 16, 23, and 26 (Spanish, 12 folios).

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Burials - 18th Century
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Burials
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 7 - Burials contains records created in Florida during the eighteenth century.  These records pertain to Indians, Blacks, Europeans, and Creoles.  There are two sets of burial records.  One set was originally bound in a volume entitled, "Libro 2 de entierros de blancos y morenos empiezo en 1720 a 1743," but are now only loose folios.  This first set of burial records ranges from 7 June 1720 to 10 July 1743 and comprises folios [1]r-151v.  At a minimum, each entry contains the date and location of burial; the individual's name, and if too young to have received a name, then a parent's name; which last rites, if any, were administered; name and title of presiding priest;  whether free or enslaved, and if enslaved, the owner's name.   Additional information includes: legitimacy of birth; individual's nationality or place of previous or current residence; parents' names; place of death; spouse's name, nationality or place of previous or current residence; military rank and/or administrative title of any male named in the entry; age at death; cause of death.  In the second set of burial records, only the burials of individuals designated as morenos, pardos or indios appear in these entries.  Due to the presence of a detiorated title page, the second set of burial records seem to have been originally bound and entitled, "Libro de la paroquial mayor de esta ciudad de San Agustin de la Florida que se asientan los entierros de morenos y pardos," but are now only loose folios.  These burial records range from March 1736 to June 1763 and comprise folios 1r-71v.  At a minimum, each entry in this second set records the date of burial; name and title of priest; the individual's name, and if too young to have received a name, then a parent's name;  and place of burial.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: whether the individual is enslaved or free, and if enslaved, the owner's name; if known, parents' names and nationalities or places previous or current residence; individual's nationality or place of previous residence; spouse's name; number of children; whether or not they had a will; legitimacy of birth; which last rites were administered; cause of death; military rank and/or administrative title of any male named in the entry.
format: Loose folios and 1 previously-bound volume now in the form of loose folios.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms - 1720-1737
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 6 - Baptisms contains records created in Florida during the eighteenth century.  All of these records pertain to Indians, Blacks, Europeans, and Creoles.  The baptismal records were originally bound in a volume entitled "Libro 4 bautismos, 1720 - 1737," but are now only loose folios.  This set of baptismal records ranges from June 1720 to April 1737 and comprises approximately 190 folios.  At a minimum, each entry provides the date of baptism; name and title of priest who performed the baptism; if known, names of parents; names of godparents; if not Spanish, then nationality, racial designation, skin color, or enslavement status.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: legitimacy of birth; parents' and/or godparents' nationality or place of previous or current residency; names and titles of other presiding officials; military rank and/or administrative title of any male named in the entry; date of birth or approximate age at baptism.
format: 1 previously-bound volume now in the form of loose folios

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms - 17th and 18th Centuries
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 5 - Baptisms contains records created in Florida during the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries.  There are two sets of baptismal records.  The first set was originally bound in a volume entitled "Libro 3 bautismos españoles, 1695-1720," but are now only loose folios.  Though this first set is supposed to be records of Spaniards (españoles), it contains at least one entry of a young black child (referred to as negra).  This set ranges from 12 January 1695 to 29 April 1720 and comprises folios 1r-13[7]v.  At a minimum, each entry in this first set of baptismal records provides the name of the individual receiving baptism; date of baptism; name and title of priest who performed the baptism; if known, then names of parents; and name/s of godparent/s (padrino/s).  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: the military rank and/or administrative title of any male named in the entry; legitimacy of individual's birth; day of birth or approximate age at baptism; health condition at birth; enslavement status of individual and/or parents, and when applicable, name/s of owner/s.  The second set of baptismal records are abridged entries of baptismal records contained in Box 3.  These abridged baptismal records range from 1640 to 1694.  The years 1657 and 1660 are missing from this set, and the years 1661 and 1694 are incomplete.
format: Loose folios and 1 previously-bound volume now in the form of loose folios

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms and Marriages  - 18th Century
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Marriages
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 8 - Baptisms and Marriages contains records created in Florida during the eighteenth century.  These records pertain to Indians, Blacks, Europeans, and Creoles.  There are two sets of marriage records.  The first set of marriage records appears to have been part of a previously-bound volume due to the presence of a highly deteriorated title page that reads, "Libro de la parroquial mayor de esta ciudad de San Agustin de la Florida donde se asientan los casamientos de los pardos."  This first set ranges from October 1735 to May 1763 and comprises folios 1r-53v.  These marriages are between either an español and negro/a, moreno/a, pardo/a, indio/a, or mestizo/a; or between negros, morenos, pardos, indios, and/or mestizos.  The entries explain if the bride and/or groom were previously married, and if so, then to whom and whether the individuals were free or enslaved.  They provide the witnesses' names and parents' names of both the bride and groom, and the nationality or places of previous or current residence.  Some locations that appear in the first set of marriage records include: Apalachee, Arará, Brasil, Carabalí, Carolina, Cartagena, Conga, Guinea, Havana, Inglaterra, Isla de la Palma, Jamaica, Machaba, Madrid, Mandinga, Mina, Nueva Inglaterra, Palica, Samba, Tenerife, Tolomato.  The second set of marriage records also appears to have been part of a previously-bound volume due to the presence of a highly deteriorated title page that reads, "Libro de matrimonios de la parroquial de San Agustin de la Florida."  This second set ranges from June 1720 to August 1756 and comprises folios 1r-218v.  These marriages are almost entirely between españoles.  The baptismal records comprise a single folio and document baptisms of both negros and españoles during May 1720.
format: Loose folios and 2 previously-bound volumes now in the form of loose folios.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms - 1735-1763
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 10 - Baptisms contains records created in Florida during the eighteenth century.  The majority of individuals represented in Box 10 - Baptisms are African or of African ancestry, and few of the individuals seem to be Indian or of Indian ancestry. These baptismal records range from November 1735 through January 1763 and comprise folios 1r-180v.  Though no folios are missing, number 171 was skipped during the pagination process.  These baptismal records were originally bound in a volume entitled "Libro 1 de baptismos de pardos y morenos," but are now only loose folios.  All entries include the date of baptism, the individual's general age at baptism (e.g., adulto/a, párvulo/a, criatura, niño/a), whether s/he is free or enslaved (and if enslaved, the owner's name), names (if known) and status (esclavo or libre) of parents, and name of godparent.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: individual's and/or parents' nationality or place of previous or current residency; date of birth; racial designation of the individual, parents, and godparents (negro/a, moreno/a, pardo/a, indio/a, mestizo/a, moreno/a criollo/a, and pardo/a criollo/a); and the individual's age at baptism.  Some of the place names that occur in this set are: Angola, Antequera, Arará, Campeche, Caracas, Caravalí, Carolina, Chiaja, Congo, Córdoba, Espejo, Fledelphia (Philadelphia), Granada, Inglaterra, Isla de la Palma, Málaga, Mandinga, Maracaibo, Meca-meca, Mérida, Mina, Motril, Nueva York, Osuche, Palica, Puebla de los Angeles (Puebla), Puerto Real, Puerto de Santa María, Roatán, San Jorge, Sultepeque, Tolomato, Yguaja.
format: Loose folios and 1 previously-bound volume now in the form of loose folios.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Burials and Confirmations - 18th Century
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Burials
Confirmations
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 9 - Burials and Confirmations contains records created in Florida during the eighteenth century.  These records pertain to Indians, Blacks, Europeans, and Creoles.  The set of confirmation records ranges from August 1735 to April 1763 and comprises folios 1r-67v.  Though the pagination is sequential, without any pages missing, various dates are unaccounted for (missing years: most of 1755, and all of 1756-1761).  Folios 1-25 contain August 1735 through January 1745; folios 25-27 contain April 1745; folios 28-45 contain April 1754 through February 1755; folios 46-67 contain December 1762 through April 1763.  The earlier records seem to only document confirmations of white Europeans or Creoles.  Each entry gives the first name of the individual, and full names of the parents and godparents.  In some instances, in place of the parents' names, a nationality is provided.  For instance, "de nación de Suisa" (fol. 26r) and "aleman" (fol. 27r).  By the 1760s, entries appear that include confirmations of negros and morenos either free or enslaved.  The burial records were oringally bound in a volume entitled "Libro 3 de entierros de españoles."  These burial records range from 19 July 1743 through 17 November 1763 and comprise folios 1r-155v.  All entries state the name of the individual who was buried, the parents' names (if known), and the date of burial.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: the individual's occupation, approximate age, heirs, nationality or place of previous residency, and spouse's name.  There is also a random folio containing burial records of two men who died at the Spanish fort in Apalachee in 1743 and short entries regarding burials in the years 1754 and 1756.
format: Loose folios and 1 previously-bound volume now in the form of loose folios.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms - 1760-1763
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 13 - Baptisms contains records of baptisms performed during the eighteenth century in Florida. Presumably, only individuals of predominantly white ancestry are recorded in these documents.  These baptismal records were  originally bound in a volume entitled, "Libro 7 de baptismos de españoles, 1760-1763," but are now only loose folios.  There are two types of baptismal entries in this volume.  The first type has entries that range from 27 September 1760 to 18 December 1763 and comprise folios 2r-72v.   At a minimum, each entry records the date of baptism; name of the individual receiving baptism; legitimacy of the individual's birth (legitimate/illegitimate); if known, the parents' names and nationalities or places of previous or current residency; godparents' names; and the name and title of the priest who performed the baptism. Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: the individual's date of birth, health condition at time of baptism, place that baptism occurred, and political or military position of parent and/or godparent.  The second type of baptismal entry records church decrees, which mandate the entry of previously-performed baptisms into the libros de bautismos de españoles de Florida.  Each entry has two dates: the date of the church decree and the date of the actual baptism.  These entries are ordered chronologically by the date of the church decree, which range from 1780 to 1820.  The dates of the baptisms range from 1740 to 1791.  These entries comprise folios 73r-75v.  Information in the church decrees include:  the date of the decree (auto),  who presented the decree,  and who carried out the decree.  The baptismal-entry portion follows the precedents set by the baptisms listed above.  The pagination skips number 52, but no folios are missing.
format: Loose folios and 1 previously-bound volume now in the form of loose folios.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms - 1737-1751
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 11 - Baptisms contains records created in Florida during the eighteenth century.  Presumably, only individuals of predominantly white ancestry are documented in these records.  These baptismal records appear to have been part of a previously-bound volume due to the presence of a highly deteriorated title page that reads "Libro 5 de bautismos de españoles."  The entries range from May 1737 to October 1751 and comprise folios 1r-198v.  At a minimum, each entry records the name of the individual receiving baptism; the date of baptism; if known, the parents' names and nationalities or places of previous residence; godparent's name; and the name of the priest who performed the baptism.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: individual's date of birth or approximate age at baptism, individual's health condition at time of baptism, place that baptism occurred, military rank and/or administrative title of any male named in the entry.  Some of the place names that occur in this set of documents are: A Coruña, Almagro, Arévalo, Ávila, Badajoz, Baena, Barcelona, Cádiz, Carolina, Córdoba, Dublin, Filadelfia, Galicia, Granada, Havana, Irlanda, Isla de Palma, Jerez de la Frontera, Lambrique (in Irlanda), Lucena, Málaga, Maracaibo, Mataró, Motril, Narila, Ondara, Pensilvania, Puebla, Puerto del Principe, Puerto de Santa Maria, Riba de Sella (Ribadesella), San Andrés de Cedeira (San Andrés de Teixido), San Lúcar de Barrameda, Santa Fe, Seville, Tenerife, Toledo, Valencia, Veracruz, Villanueva del Fresno, Zaragosa.
format: Loose folios and 1 previously-bound volume now in the form of loose folios.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms - 1751-1760
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 12 - Baptisms contains records created in Florida during the eighteenth century. Presumably, only individuals of predominantly white ancestry are recorded in these documents.  These baptismal records appear to have been part of a previously-bound volume due to the presence of a moderately-deteriorated title page that reads "Libro 6 de bautismos españoles." The entries range from 2 November 1751 to 31 July 1760 and comprise folios 3r-199v.  At a minimum, each entry records the name of the individual receiving baptism; legitimacy of the individual's birth (legitimate/illegitimate); if known, the parents' names and nationalities or places of previous or current residence; godparents' name; and the name and title of the priest who performed the baptism. Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: the individual's date of birth, health condition at time of baptism, place that baptism occurred, and military rank and/or administrative title of any male named in the entry.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Multi-Source Index
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Marriages
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 15 - Index contains an index of marriages and abridged marriage and baptismal records originally created in Florida during the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries.  There are four parts.  The first part is an index of marriages presumably between Minorcans.  Each marriage is listed twice: once by the first letter of the bride's surname, and once by the first letter of the groom's surname.  The entries are then placed in chronological order according to the date of the marriage.  The index covers all of the marriages from Box 14 - Golden Book of the Minorcans, and partially from Box 18 - Marriages and Box 27 - Marriages.  The second part contains abridged marriage entries (COMPLETE THIS PART)   The third part contains abridged entries from baptismal records contained in the fifth book of white baptisms (Box 33) and ranges from 1839-1851.  Each abridged entry provides the name of the individual being baptised, the date of the baptism, and the associated entry number.  The fourth part contains a single marriage entry from 1854.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms - 1784-1792
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 16 - Baptisms contains records created during the eighteenth century in Florida.  Presumably, only individuals of predominantly white ancestry are recorded in these documents, though there is at least one Indian baptism.  In the twentieth century, these baptismal records were re-bound and given the title, "Baptisms White 1784-1792 I." Due to significant tearing, pages 1-4 (containing entries 1-10) were not bound and appear separately.  These separate pages record baptisms performed from 8 October 1784 to 12 January 1785.    The entries in the bound volume range from 16 January 1785 to 30 July 1792, contain entries 11-521, and comprise pages 5-271.  At a minimum, each entry records the date of baptism; date of the individual's birth or approximate age; name of the individual receiving baptism; legitimacy of the individual's birth (legitimate/illegitimate); if known, the parents' names and nationalities or places of previous or current residence; godparents' name; and the name and title of the priest who performed the baptism.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following:  health condition at time of baptism, place that baptism occurred, military rank and/or administrative title of any male named in the entry, spouse's name, place of birth, first name before baptism, and previous religious affiliation (e.g., Anabaptist, Anglican, Lutheran, Quaker).  Included is a twentieth-century, typed index, loosely alphabetized by the individuals' first names.
format: 1 volume and 2 loose folios.  1 typed, twentieth-century index

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Golden Book of the Minorcans - 18th Century
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Marriages
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 14 - Golden Book of the Minorcans contains baptismal and marriage records created during the eighteenth century in Florida.  Presumably, only Mincorcans or individuals of Minorcan ancestry are recorded in these documents.  These records were originally bound in a volume entitled, "Liber secundus dico [illegible] baptismorum parochia Sancti Petri Florida Orientalis." The baptismal records range from 1768-1784 and have multiple pagination sequences.  The majority of the baptismal records provide the name of the individual receiving baptism; the names of the parents, padrinos, and priest who performed the baptism; and date of baptism and birth.  The marriage records range from 1776-1783 and have multipe pagination sequences.  The majority of the marriage records provide the date of the marriage, the names of the bride and groom; names of witnesses and parents; if a widow or widower; parents and/or individuals' places of previous residence; and name and title of priest performing the wedding.

subject: Baptisms
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 17 - Baptisms contains records created during the eighteenth century in Florida.  Individuals whose baptisms are recorded in these documents are designated as either negro/a, mulato/a, moreno/a, pardo/a, indio/a, or mestizo/a.  These records were originally bound in a volume entitled, "Libro primero de bautismos de negros y mulatos..."  In the twentieth century, these baptismal records were re-bound and given the title, "Baptisms Colored 1784-1793 I."  The records range from 1 August 1784 to 21 October 1793, contain 388 entries (plus an unnumbered entry at the end), and comprise pages 1-174.  At a minimum, each entry  includes the date of baptism; the individual's date of birth or approximate age at baptism; whether s/he is free or enslaved (and if enslaved, the owner's name); names (if known) and status (esclavo or libre) of parents; name of godparent; the name and title of the priest who performed the baptism; racial designation or skin color of the individual and parents (negro/a, moreno/a, mulato/a, pardo/a, indio/a, mestizo/a); if known, nationality or place of previous residency.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: nationality or place of previous residency of the slave owner and/or godparents, and previous religious affiliation (e.g., Anglican, Lutheran).  Included is a twentieth-century, typed index, alphabetized by the first letter of the individuals' surnames.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Marriages - 1784-1801
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Marriages
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 18 - Marriages contains records created during the late-eighteenth and early-nineteenth centuries in Florida.  Presumably, only individuals of predominantly white ancestry are recorded in these documents.  These records were originally bound in a volume entitled, "Libro primero de matrimonios de blancos..."  In the twentieth century, these marriage records were re-bound and given the title, "White Marriages 1784-1801 I."  The records range from 21 November 1784 to 30 December 1801, contain 206 entries, and comprise pages 1-188.  At a minimum, each entry includes the date of the marriage; the bride's and groom's names; whether the bride and groom were previously married (soltero/a, viudo/a) and if so, to whom; bride's and groom's places of current residence, and nationalities or previous places of residence; if known, the bride's and groom's parents' names and nationalities or places of previous or current residence; names of witnesses (testigos); who read the banns of marriage (tres amonestaciones); who carried out the marriage investigation (diligencias de soltería); and name and title of the presiding priest.  Information that sometimes appears includes: the church calendar days on which the banns of marriage (tres amonestacinoes) were read; and military rank and/or administrative title of any males named in the entry.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms and Infant Deaths - 18th and 19th Centuries
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Burials
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 20 - Baptisms and Infant Deaths contains records created during the late-eighteenth and early-nineteenth centuries in Florida.  Presumably, only individuals of predominantly white ancestry are recorded in the infant death entries  Individuals referred to as moreno/a, cuarterona, and parda appear in the baptismal records.  It seems that the infant death records were originally bound in  a volume entitled, "Libro primero de párvulos blancos difuntos..."  In the twentieth century, these burial records were re-bound, combined with the baptismal records, and given the title, "Deaths Inf. White 1784-1826."  The burials records range from 28 December 1784 to 3 August 1827, contain 413 entries, comprise pages 1-156.   All infant death entries include the date of death; date and place of burial; the infant's name and age at death; if known, parents' names, nationalities or places of previous residence, and military rank and/or administrative title (if applicable); and name and title of presiding priest.  The baptismal records are from 1807, paginated as 1 and 2, and contain 5 entries.   All the baptismal records include the name of the individual; date of baptism; either date of birth or age at baptism; whether free or enslaved, and if enslaved, the owner's name; if known, parents' names; parents' nationalities or previous places of residence; whether parents are free or enslaved, and skin color; godparents' names, skin color, free or enslaved, and if enslaved, the owner's name.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Marriages - 1784-1882
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Marriages
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 21 - Marriages contains records created during the late-eighteenth and nineteenth centuries.  These marriages are between either an individual with an unspecified skin color (presumably white) and a negro/a, mulato/a, moreno/a, pardo/a, indio/a, or mestizo/a; or between negros/as, morenos/as, pardos/as, indios/as, and/or mestizos/as.   These marriage records range from 1784 to 15 June 1882.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Deaths - 1784-1809
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Burials
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 19 - Deaths contains records created during the late-eighteenth and early-nineteenth centuries in Florida.  Presumably, only individuals of predominantly white ancestry are recorded in these documents.  These records were originally bound in a  volume entitled, "Libro primero de adultos blancos difuntos..."  In the twentieth century, these burial records were re-bound and given the title, "Deaths White 1784-1809 I."  The records range from 6 October 1784 to 22 October 1809, contain (supposedly) 437 entries, and comprise pages 1-163.  At a minimum, each entry includes the date of death; date and place of burial; the individual's name, age at death, marriage status (soltero/a, viudo/a, marido/a), standing in the church, spouse's name (if applicable), nationality or place of previous residence, military rank and/or administrative title (if applicable); if known, parents' names; which, if any, of the last rites were administered; and name and title of the presiding priest.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: whether or not the individual left a will; parents' nationalities or places of previous  or current residence; individual's occupation (e.g., sastre); and previous religious affiliation (e.g., Calvinist, Protestant).

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Deaths - 1785-1821
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Burials
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 22 - Deaths contains records created during the late-eighteenth and early-nineteenth centuries in Florida.  Individuals whose deaths are recorded in these documents are designated as either negro/a, mulato/a, moreno/a, pardo/a, indio/a, or mestizo/a.  These records lack a title page, so if they were originally bound, the title is unknown.  However, in the twentieth century, these death records were presumably re-bound in a volume entitled, "Deaths Colored 1785-1821."  The death records range from 1784 to 4 August 1821 with a single entry from 1897, contain 224 entries, and comprise pages 1-96.  At a minimum, each entry records the name of the individual who died; date of death; date and place of burial; and the individual's approximate age at time of death; the individual's nationality or place of previous residence; whether individual was free or enslaved (and if enslaved, name of owner) ; which, if any, of the last rites were administered; if known, parents' names, skin color, whether free or enslaved (and if enslaved, name of owner); name and title of presiding priest.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: individual's skin color (e.g., pardo/a, negro/a, moreno/a); place of death; marital status; spouse's name; military rank of individual, spouse, and/or parent; and whether the individual left a will.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms - 1792-1799
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 23 - Baptisms contains records created during the late-eighteenth century in Florida.  Presumably, only individuals of predominantly white ancestry are recorded in these documents, which were originally bound in a volume entitled, "Libro segundo de baptismos de blancos..."  In the twentieth century, these baptismal records were re-bound and given the title, "Baptisms White 1792-1799 II."  The records range from 30 July 1792 to 10 June 1799, contain 583 entries, and due to damage,has only partly legible pagination. At a mimimum, each entry records the date of baptism; date of the individual's birth or age at baptism; name of the individual receiving baptism; legitimacy of the individual's birth (legitmate/illegitimate); if known, the parents' names and nationalities or places of previous or current residency; godparents' names; and the name and title of the priest who performed the baptism. Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following:  health condition at time of baptism, place that baptism occured, political or military position of parent and/or godparent, spouse's name, place of birth, first name before baptism, and previous religious affiliation (e.g., Anglican, Baptist).

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms - 1793-1807
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 25 - Baptisms contains records created during the late-eighteenth and early-nineteenth centuries in Florida.  Individuals whose baptisms are recorded in these documents are designated as either negro/a, mulato/a, moreno/a, pardo/a, indio/a, or mestizo/a.  These records were originally bound in a volume entitled, "libro segundo de baptismos de negros y mulatos..."  In the twentieth century, these baptismal records were re-bound and given the title, "Book of Baptism of Colored People 1793-1807."  The records range from 21 October 1793 to 12 May 1807, contain 818 entries, and comprise pages 1-354.   At a minimum, each entry records the date of baptism; the individual's date of birth or age at baptism; whether s/he is free or enslaved (and if enslaved, the owner's name); if the parents are known, then their names, racial designation or skin color, and whether enslaved or free; name of godparent; the name and title of the priest who performed the baptism;  individual's nationality or place of previous residency.  Additional information includes, but is not limited to, the following: nationality or place of previous residency of the slaveowner and/or godparents, the individual's previous religious affiliation, military or political position of individual, parent and/or godparent, place of birth, health condition at time of baptism, place that baptism occured, marital status, spouse's name.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Marriages - 1802-1832
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Marriages
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 27 - Marriages contains records created during the early-nineteenth century in Florida.  Presumably, only individuals of predominantly white ancestry are recorded in these documents.  These records were originally bound in a volume entitled, "Libro segundo de matrimonios de blancos..."  In the twentieth century, these baptismal records were re-bound and given the title, "White Marriages 1802-1832 II."  The records range from 7 January 1802 to 14 June 1832, contain 397 entries and comprise pages 1-263.  The last dozen or so entries are in loose chronological order.  At a minimum, each entry includes the date of the marriage; the bride's and groom's names; whether the bride and groom were previously married (soltero/a, viudo/a) and if so, to whom; bride's and groom's places of current residence, and nationalities or previous places of residence; if known, the bride's and groom's parents' names and nationalities or places of previous residence; names of witnesses (testigos); who read the banns of marriage (tres amonestaciones); who carried out the marriage investigation (diligencias/información de soltería); and name and title of the presiding priest.  Information that sometimes appears includes: the church calendar days on which the banns of marriage (tres amonestacinoes) were read; and military rank and/or administrative title of any males named in the entry.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms - 1800-1815
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 26 - Baptisms contains records created during the early-nineteenth century in Florida.  Presumably, only individuals of predominantly white ancestry are recorded in these documents.  These records were originally bound in a volume entitled, "libro tercero de bautismos de blancos..."  In the twentieth century, these baptismal records were re-bound and given the title, "Baptisms White 1800-1815 III."  The records range from 1 January 1800 to 26 December 1815, contain 913 entries, and comprise pages 1-440.  The final page (p. 441) has two addendums to earlier entries. At a minimum, each entry records the date of baptism; date of the individual's birth or age at baptism; name of the individual receiving baptism; legitimacy of the individual's birth; if known, the parents' names and nationalities or places of previous residence; godparents' names and places of current residency; name and title of priest who performed the baptism.  Additional information includes: grandparents' names, nationalities or places of previous residence; military rank and/or administrative title of any male mentioned in the entry; previous religious affiliation; marital status; spouse's name; health condition at time of baptism; individual's nationality or place of previous residency.  Includes a twentieth-century, typed index, alphabetized by last name.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms - 1807-1848
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 28 - Baptisms contains records created during the nineteenth century in Florida.  Individuals whose baptisms are recorded in these documents are designated as either negro/a, mulato/a, moreno/a, or pardo/a.  In the twentieth centry, these baptismal records were either bound or re-bound and given the title, "Baptisms Colored 1807-1848 III."  The records range from 8 July 1807 to 25 December 1848, contain over 1,000 entries, and comprise pages 3-343.  The entries written in Spanish contain considerably more information than those written in English.  The Spanish entries, at a minimum, record the date of baptism; the individual's date of birth or age at baptism; whether s/he is free or enslaved (and if enslaved, the owner's name); if the parents are known, then their names, racial designation or skin color, and whether enslaved or free; name of godparent; the name and title of the priest who performed the baptism;  individual's nationality or place of previous residency.  Additional information provided in the Spanish entries includes: nationality or place of previous residency of the slaveowner and/or godparents; the individual's previous religious affiliation; military or political position of individual, parent and/or godparent; place of birth; health condition at time of baptism; place that baptism occured; marital status; spouse's name; names of grandparents.  The English entries, at a minimum, record either the the year of baptism or date of birth, name of individual, and name of the priest who performed the baptism.  In the English entries, the additional information varies widely.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Deaths - 1809-1882
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Burials
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 29 - Deaths contains records created during the nineteenth century in Florida.  {resumably ony individuals of predominantly white ancestry are recorded in these documents. These documents were originally bound in a volume entitled, "libro segundo de adultos blancos difuntos…"  In the twentieth century, these death records were re-bound and given the title, "Deaths White and Colored 1809-1882 II."  The records range from 25 October 1809 to 17 May 1882, contain at least 400 entries, and comprise pages 1-216.  The contents of each entry varies widely.  At the very least, each entry includes the name of the individual, date of death, and age at death.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine

volumes.title: Baptisms - 1816-1838
creator: Digitization  of the Archives of the Diocese of St. Augustine (DADS)
subject: Baptisms
Spanish Florida
volumes.description: Box 30 - Baptisms contains records created during the nineteenth century in Florida.  Presumably only individuals of predominantly white ancestry are recorded in these documents. These documents were originally bound in a volume entitled, "Libro quarto de bautismos de blancos…," but are now only loose folios.   These records range from 13 January 1816 to 13 February 1839 and comprise pages 1-452. The Spanish entries contain considerably more information than the Latin entries.  At a minimum each Spanish entry records the date of baptism; date of the individual's birth or age at baptism; name of the individual receiving baptism; legitimacy of the individual's birth; if known, the parents' names and nationalities or places of previous residence; godparents' names and places of current residency; name and title of priest who performed the baptism.  Additional information includes: grandparents' names, nationalities or places of previous residence; military rank and/or administrative title of any male mentioned in the entry; previous religious affiliation; marital status; spouse's name; health condition at time of baptism; individual's nationality or place of previous residency.   At a minimum, each Latin entry records name given at baptism, date of baptism, names of sponsors, names of parents, and name of priest who performed the baptism.  Additional information that appears in the Latin entries includes: legitimacy of birth, and date of birth. Included is a twentieth-century, typed index, alphabetized by last name.

coverage.institution: Archives of the Diocese of St Augustine
